metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29921 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Python before 3,9,5, the ipaddress library mishandles leading zero characters in the octets of an IP address string. This (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-29921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10 - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10 - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-examples - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-full - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-venv - 3.10.0~b1-2
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9 - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-full - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.5-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in v3.8.0a4 This issue was re-introduced in python3.8 in focal because of the SRU in LP: #1928057

criterions.comment: python3.10 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.0~b1-2').
python3.9 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.5-2ubuntu1').
